info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:03PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Macon and central Jackson Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 403 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Franklin, or 4 miles northwest of Lake Glenville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Cashiers, Lake Glenville, Cullowhee, Highlands, Ellijay, Tuckasegee, Whiteside Mountain and Cullasaja. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western North Carolina.
